introduction: The following passage is adapted from Astronomy Through the Ages by Karim Fontes (2021).
text: Centuries ago, astronomers relied on hand-drawn star charts. By cataloguing thousands of celestial objects, they laid the groundwork for future discoveries, which ______ incomplete without these meticulous observations.
question: Which choice completes the text so that it conforms to the conventions of Standard English? Consider how the relative pronoun which refers back to future discoveries.
explanation: Choice A is correct because it properly indicates a hypothetical condition in the past (would have been incomplete). B have been changes the meaning and tense incorrectly. C had being is ungrammatical. D was incomplete does not capture the conditional nature of those future discoveries.
